column4: i noob here, ubuntu 11.04; i'm having an issue where options on the frames of windows do not appear until they are maximized
so if I understand you the windows are not showing the top panel with the buttons unless you maximize tem?
yeah, like thinks l ike "view" "options" stuff like that
have you installed the compiz config settings manager and changed anything?
i don't think so, i'm kind of a noob, i download this image, installed it, then did the software update, and installed a video driver, that is it
try in the terminal compiz --replace and see if that fixes it.
i ran the command "compiz --replace" you suggested in the terminal, its been running for about 5 mins... its that normal?
hmmm not sure, i don't see anything different, the "menus" are still missing (unless their window is maximized)
here is a imagebin link if you need one. http://imagebin.org/index.php?page=add
I see what you mean I have the same problem at times, but I have tweaked compiz to have the cube, there is also metacity --replace to use that desktop renderer.
ok now i'm really in trouble, my gui seems to be jack up... is there a keyboard short cut to spawn a terminal?
crtl-alt-f2will take you to a tty, just rebooting or logging out would, get you back the desktop.
